description.narrative: 1. Increased access to finance for small enterprises: The proposed investment will increase access to finance to small enterprises with a special focus on regions that are the most affected by the SuTP influx. 2. Inclusiveness: IFC anticipates that the investment will foster financial inclusiveness by demonstrating to other industry players the need and commercial viability of expanding credit in less developed regions

The proposed financing package involves an (i) up to US$50 million A Loan from IFCs own accounts; (ii) a B1 Loan of up to US$22 million; and an additional (iii) up to US$18.75 million Trust Loan from IFC acting as in its capacity as implementing entity for the Managed Co-Lending Portfolio Program to Türkiye Garanti Bankasi A.S. (Garanti BBVA), which is a systematically important Turkish bank headquartered in Istanbul (the Project). The tenor of the financing package is six-years with two-year grace and proceeds of the investment will be used to support small enterprises located in the southeastern and eastern provinces of Turkey with a high presence of Syrians under Temporary Protection (SuTP) with the aim to contribute to the sustainable development of the country.

mailing-address.narrative: Türkiye Garanti Bankasi A.S. Mr. Deniz Caner Kurt Supervisor +90 (212) 318 17 32 canerkurt@garantibbva.com.tr Nispetiye Mah. Aytar Cad. No. 2 Levent Besiktas Istanbul www.garantibbva.com.tr

name.narrative: Garanti BBVA is headquartered in Istanbul, Turkey. Proposed financing package will be used to increase lending to small enterprises in southeastern and eastern provinces of Turkey. These provinces are: Mardin, Batman, Sirnak, Siirt, Sanliurfa, Diyarbakir, Gaziantep, Adiyaman, Kilis, Hatay, Kahramanmaras, Osmaniye, Van, Mus, Bitlis, Hakkari, Adana, Icel (Mersin), Agri, Kars, Igdir, Ardahan.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

title.narrative: Summary of Investment Information - Anticipated Impact Measurement & Monitoring (AIMM) Assessment and Main Environmental & Social Risks and Impacts of the Project
